content: Since @Dragonbot isn't putting links to new forum posts here yet, here's a post I just made that I could use help with: https://forum.backdropcms.org/forum/colourising-images-css
What an interesting thing to be working on! :thinking:

PHP provides some functions to get color information out of a picture that you could use and then you could do some math to figure out what the angle should be for shifting with filter. https://www.php.net/manual/en/function.imagecolorat.php#70783

@BWPanda (Peter) It may not be exactly what you had in mind, but I just did a quick test with Image Effects:

  • Activate Image Effects and Image Effects Color Actions
  • Create a new Image Style
  • Add the "Desaturate" effect
  • Add the "Color Shift" effect and choose your color
    Here's how your example came out:
    Screenshot_2020-03-11-colorized.png
@Laryn Ah! I didn't realise I had to enable a separate sub-module :face_palm: Thanks, that might just be the solution!
I think the 'Color multiply' effect works best... Thanks for pointing that out :smile:

There's also CSS that can do this now, the support is pretty good: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/mix-blend-mode

mix-blend-mode
The mix-blend-mode CSS property sets how an element's content should blend with the content of the element's parent and the element's background.
